etymology.description: 高 “high; elevated” + 麗 “beautiful; elegant” → dynastic name adopted for the Korean state; later generalized to refer to Korea in historical contexts.
etymology.interpretation: Names the Goryeo dynasty (918–1392) and, by extension in historical or archaic usage, Korea or Korean things. Also the source of the English name Korea via its Sino-Korean reading.
etymology.simplification: 麗 was simplified to 丽 to reduce strokes; 高 remained unchanged.

examples.chinese: 高丽是中世纪的朝鲜王朝(高麗是中世紀的朝鮮王朝)。
examples.pinyin: Gāolí shì Zhōngshìjì de Cháoxiǎn wángcháo.
examples.english: Goryeo was a medieval Korean dynasty.

examples.chinese: 他专门研究高丽历史(他專門研究高麗歷史)。
examples.english: He specializes in researching Goryeo history.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢喝高丽参茶(我喜歡喝高麗參茶)。
examples.english: I like to drink Korean ginseng tea.
